page.title: 07Social Concerns,Erdington.
page.content: Over 400 home owners of houses built in 1920's by M.A.Boswell are stunned. Routine maintenance work in March 1984 revealed serious structural cracks in walls and "top to bottem" splits in gable ends.Boswell houses are built of Cunker concrete,supported by precast concrete columns.Horrified home owners enlisted the help of Mr.R.Corbett M.P. and councillor Carole McKeown,to approach the Minister of Housing,Mr. Ian Gow,with a view to designating ALL Boswell houses as defective.Home owners would then be able to claim a government grant of up to _12,600 for structural repairs and the underpinning of the foundations,therefore making the properties mortgage worthy.
